"Not a shuttle per se," Jackie admits.  "But we might be able to 
modify one of the escape pods."

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Nic <wingedwarrior41@h...>" 
<wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> Ragnar: Do you have any shuttle on the ship, quineg?
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "cardhead649 <cardhead649@y...>"
> <cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> > "Sounds like a plan," Wheeljack points out.  "Now all we need is 
a 
> > shuttle."
> > 
> > OOC: This is, unfortunately, true - RPG rules are working against 
us 
> > on this.  Opportunity knocks if the Maximal ship was equipped 
with 
> > escape modules of some kind ...
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Nic <wingedwarrior41@h...>" 
> > <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > > OOC: I'm trying to get rid of those three so I can eventually 
bring 
> > in
> > > other chars. Just help me on that! :)
> > > 
> > > BIC:
> > > 
> > > Ragnar: Ah! That is similar to the technology we use. Now, I 
think
> > > that if we can modify a shuttle with some of these elements, we 
may 
> > be
> > > able to go back.
> > > 
> > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "cardhead649 <cardhead649@y...>"
> > > <cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> > > > OOC: This is partly conjecture on my part.  Anyone who knows 
more 
> > > > about the pseudo-science behind this, feel free to correct me.
> > > > 
> > > > "Well, we use a device called the transwarp drive." Jackie 
> > > > explains.  "It creates a fold in the fabric of space-time, 
> > allowing 
> > > > us to travel incredible distances in a relatively brief 
period.  
> > It 
> > > > requires some precise calculations to keep from flying right 
into 
> > > > something on the other side, but that's what computers are 
for.  
> > The 
> > > > gizmo also doubles as a time machine of sorts."
> > > > 
> > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Nic <wingedwarrior41@h...>" 
> > > > <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > > > > Ragnar: So, how do you travel so far between the stars and 
how 
> > do 
> > > > you
> > > > > jump in the past?
